article:
The 'Comprehensive Soldier Fitness' (CSF) is a program of the United States Army
that was launched in October 2009. Rodgers, Monica (27 September 2010) [http://www.army.mil/-news/2010/09/27/45723-comprehensive-soldier-fitness-
marks-change-in-army-culture/ Comprehensive Soldier Fitness marks change in Army
culture]. Retrieved on 7 January 2011 With the long wars in Afghanistan
and Iraq, many soldiers experienced financial, marital and other personal
problems, presumably due to serial deployments and spending significant periods
of time away from their families. The Army approached the University of
Pennsylvania Resiliency Project
team [http://www.ppc.sas.upenn.edu/prpsum.htm Resilience Research in
Children]. Positive Psychology Center. (n.d.) Retrieved on 5 January 2011
with developing a program for the Army to teach resiliency to Soldiers. After
the expenditure of approximately $117Â million, a program was developed.
They developed the Master Resilience Training program (MRT) [http://positivepsychologynews.com/news/sherri-
fisher/200911255563 Fisher, S. (25 November 2009). Using positive psychology to
prevent PTSD]. Positive Psychology News Daily. Retrieved on 5 January 2011
as a part of the Comprehensive Soldier Fitness program. Brigadier General Rhonda
Cornum is the director of the CSF program.
